job_description:
Company Overview:
KWESST develops and delivers next generation military and public safety technology for military and first responder customers. The company is proudly Canadian and provides Dismounted/Mounted Domain Expertise in Command-and-Control software development, integration and support services.
Job Description:
KWESST is seeking talented individuals with an expertise in the Canadian and international defence C4ISR domain to offer specialized software development and integration solutions to the Canadian Army through the Defence Software Engineering Facility (DSEF). They will be actively involved in all aspects of the software development cycle with a focus on increasing system integrity, performance, reliability, and maintainability. They will also manage, and support activities related to DLSCPM test environments, including various unclassified and classified test lab environments, at various service levels, and support any additional communities of interest and technical environments as needed.
The Senior Software Programmer will be responsible for performing the below tasks.
Job Responsibilities:
· Select and incorporate available software programs.
· Design detailed programs, flow charts, and diagrams indicating mathematical computation and sequence of machine operations necessary to copy and process data and print the results.
· Translate detailed flow charts into coded machine instructions and confer with technical personnel in planning programs.
· Verify accuracy and completeness of programs by preparing sample data and testing them by means of system acceptance test runs made by operating personnel.
· Correct program errors by revising instructions or altering the sequence of operations.
· Test instructions, and assemble specifications, flow charts, diagrams, layouts, programming, and operating instructions to document applications for later modification or reference.
· Create and modify code and software.
· Create and modify screens and reports.
· Design methods and procedures for small computer systems, and sub-system of larger systems.
· Produce forms, manuals, programs, data files, and procedures for systems and/or applications; and
· Perform any other Work related to this category.

Mandatory Qualifications:
I. Experience:
Minimum of 5 years of demonstrated experience as a Software Engineer on Military C2 systems.
Minimum of 1 year of demonstrated experience as a Programmer within an IPT for an onsite client.
Minimum one (1) year of demonstrated experience in (two) 2 of the following:
Using at least 1 of the following high-level languages (ADA (95, 05, 2012, Java, C++, or C#).
Using CASE tools (e.g., Rational Team Concert, JIRA).
Using a client mandated Software Development process (Scaled Agile Framework (SAFe)).
Performing object-oriented analysis and design.
II. Education:

University Degree or College Diploma in any discipline or technical field.

Preferred Qualifications:
Experience with one or more of the following Canadian Army C2 Specialty Applications would be an asset:
Fires Automation Targeted Effects System (FATES).
Indirect Fire Control Software Suite (IFCSS).
Engineer Command and Control Information System (EC2IS).
Variable Message Format Processor (VMFP).
Ballistic Calculator Software (BCS).
Director Armament Sustainment Program Management (DASPM).
NATO Sub-Group 2 (SG2) Sharable Software Suite.
Armaments Ballistics Kernel (NABK).
Artillery Systems Cooperation Activities (ASCA); and
Logistics Functional Area Services (LOGFAS).
Regulatory Compliance Requirements
All applicants must be able to obtain a Canadian SECRET Clearance and meet the eligibility requirements outlined in the Canadian Controlled Goods Registration Program and ITAR.
KWESST is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, marital status, national origin, age, disability of any other protected status under applicable law. We celebrate diversity and are dedicated to creating a work environment that is inclusive and welcoming to all, including LQBTQ2S+ individuals. Our hiring decisions are based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. In every step of the interview procedure, KWESST is committed to providing accommodations.
